reviews.review_msg: Jonathan Katz is a good professor, however, showing up to lecture is very important as he doesn't post any notes on canvas. His notes could definitely be clearer as it's very unorganized. He uses papers and writes a few key words as he goes, so in order to get the full notes, you have to pay attention and listen to what he's saying at all times.
he kinda makes rude jokes. final was totally fair but the course is stupid and the TAs marked way too hard and unfair

Don't take this class thinking you will enjoy it because you like to smoke pot and talk about life's big questions with your friends. This class is very in depth and unless you have a very high interest, I do not recommend it. Katz is a good professor but this course requires serious dedication, and demands quality writing.

This is not an easy class and unless you have a pretty strong interest in philosophy I would recommend avoiding it. Katz is a great professor but I found it very difficult to get a good mark on the writing assignments. Although very interesting at times, this class is just not worth the large effort unless you are VERY interested

If you are debating whether to take this course or another english, take english.  If you have Katz leading your tutorials, write your papers in support of his beliefs.  He is not open to other views despite what he tells you at the beginning of the semester.  His lectures are also straight from the text and extremely dull.
Hate his class notes.  He never specifies what is for hw.  Unclear voice, doesn't know how to teach.  Any TA would be better than him.  Boring class.  DONT TAKE HIS CLASS!!

Just read the book and  pray that you have Jordan as your TA. The assignments (essays) and final is all knowledge and concepts that can be found in the book. I finished with an A- literally sleeping through every class. Can be funny sometimes.

Very intelligent prof. Difficult to understand at times due to his level of knowledge in a 100 level course. Very helpful and responsive to questions.  Lots of writing.  5 short essay, one long essay and 8 short essay questions on exams.  However, short essay exam questions are given well ahead of exam along with 16 other possible exam questions.

Katz spends 99% of the lecture blabbing on and on while putting up notes and notes over the overhead projector for students to copy.  Either you are interested in the material and will aim to do good in this class, or you'll go to class thinking, "Why didn't I drop this course?".  He also talks a little too fast at times...

Amazing prof. Provided so much help and guidance via office hours, emails and during lectures. The subject matter of the course is very compelling, and the textbook, co-authored by the prof, is interesting and written in a relatable way. Really! Dr. Donaldson cares, and works hard to make his lectures fun. I would take another class of his any day!

Tom is hands-down one of the best profs at SFU. His lectures are extremely clear, and you can tell that he's passionate. He's also really funny! His grading criteria is reasonable and if you try your best you'll do well. If you skip a class or two, you're fine because his slides and textbook are super helpful! I cant recommend him enough

Tom is the most amazing professor I have ever met. It is obvious that he always come with clear lecture with good preparation. Moreover, his perfect London accent make him so charming so I never miss his lecture class although his lectures are not mandatory. Every time I went to his office hour, he helps me a lot even with my assignment.

1. She talks fast & has lazy voice. Listening to her is painful. 2. She has bad handwriting & her written notes are a mess. 3. If you have different opinion, it is hard to understand the readings. 4. They gave limiting topics on term essay & we are forced to stick with the reading's opinions. 5. Prepare for heavy workload & long full-day readings.
never has time for office hours. cant explain things clearly. you have to seek other help to pass this course.
Sweet man, very cute. *purr*
He made me felt that my life was meaningless.

He is a great professor.Funny and easy going.But maybe phil100 isn't his course.His style is wearing shorts..and his notes maybe kind of confusing sometimes.But he made me want to do a philsophy degree.His office has the best view.
He is living his life IRONICAlly
Easy and interesting
Really interesting course, started me off on a philosophy minor
very interesting prof...i look forward to taking another class w/ him
ohh goodness..~.~  if you have sleeping problems, go to this class..!!
lecture material is often overcomplicated, leading to confusion on course material

Jill Mcintosh is a horrible teacher. Don't take a class with her, I did not learn anything. Her lectures do not make any sense and she is all over the place. The exams are unreasonably difficult.  Exams and papers are very ambiguous, one does not know what is expected of him.

Lectures were engaging however the material itself is difficult to understand. Studying for the midterm and final doesn't mean you'll pass or do well. Questions were tricky and not at all straight forward. Definitely not a GPA booster..don't take it unless you have to or you love philosophy!
Most difficult midterm I've written in University. Questions were ambiguous and unfair. Avoid her at all costs, especially if you're looking for a gpa boost. Your GPA will go down, not up.

This class can be a challenge if you're not into philosophy or just like to coast.  However, when I put the effort into it, I found that she had a lot to offer.  As well, she makes her notes available on the internet, and we had the opportunity to rewrite out papers.  It's a good course if you put the work into it.
Two hard papers to write. First is 20% second is 30%. Hard mid terms. If you r not good at writing papers - DO NOT TAKE
She's actually a pretty good prof, she really cares for her students and helps them grasp difficult concepts.  Remember that philosophy isn't for everyone and don't take it thinking it's easy credit.
AWESOME PROF!!!  She prepares 'fill-in-the-blank' notes and emails them out to all students the night before each lecture - how amazing is that???

She's okay. Not great, not terrible. Just okay. Boring lecturer, and boring paper topics (and I liked my other phil courses). A lot of busy work. But she cares about her students and is helpful, which is nice.
BEST PROF EVER. I LOVE U DR. MAC!!! MARRY ME!!! :D :D :D

Unless you are interested in figuring something that you will never figure out, try to take another course instead. the exam is ok if you really study extremely hard for the notes. For the essay........you will never know why you always get a low mark if you are an international student.

Well for business students planning to take this phil because they think its easier than english, dont. The course requires a lot of work because of the draft copies and you have to be interested in the material. Which for me i wasnt so it was the worst experience ever. Her tests are pretty tough but dont worry the class is curved by the phil dpt.
Just the worst course ever and useless too. Do not take this course unless you have to period.

I HATED this class!! Her notes are SO disorganised and jump between subjects. The content was terrible too (nothing like I expected). The essays are marked VERY hard (I have an A average in English and bombed the essays in this class after a lot of work). Just don't take this class. Really.
Very funny, confusing tests that probably aren't a great evaluation of your knowledge, intelligent, extremely casual.
terrible prof, nuff said
confusing class...note are confusing unless you read every part of the textbk..dont take this class unless you can study everything by yourself...
very organized and clear lectures
Enjoyed Jill as a teacher for XX1, but Phil 100 was just WAY over my head.  I somehow did well, which is shocking seeing I had no clue what was going on!  Confusing class.
She made jokes that weren't funny.

In my case, she is a very good lecturer. I couoldn't understand anything in textbook. I never read any. However, her notes are extremely clear and easy to understand. For paper part, then you have to have a good TA. Anyways, I enjoyed this course. She is excellent :)

As others have said: ridiculously twisty exams, she misses the whole point of teaching philosopy. She should take a course in pedagogy, and reasses her theaching skills. Her exams are fitted more for IQ kind of tests. Very disappointed by the way this course was tought. Hard marker!!!
shes awesome

she's really nice, but her exams are quite a pain in the neck. her questions may seem easy, but she likes giving misleading questions that makes you think twice about what you think is the correct answer! overall, a fun teacher, had her for 001, too.
Tries hard to ensure you understand the ideas, but just to restate everyone else, the exams are quite difficult. Has too high of an expectation for a 100 level class.

bad lectures, she posts lecture notes online but they make no sense!  she is very unreasonable and expects too much out of a 100 level course.  exam is easy but she instructs her TAs to mark very hard on essays.  Also, she pauses 50 times  to tell people to be quiet, even tho no one is talking!

An absolutely brilliant teacher. If you're having trouble with any of the material take advantage of her office hours and she'll be glad to help you. Jill is awesome, and knowledge and reality is a great course!
I like the first part of this course. She is a good professor, knowledgable, approachable, but dont expect a high grade from this course.
nice prof. but very repetitive on minor things... like handing in hwk and such. wasted too much time on easy, simple things and not enough time on complex topics.
Interesting and lively lectures, but material is confusing. Seems approachable and open to suggestions/criticisms. Tends to go off-topic.

i agree w/ the one below. Expects so high! dun take 100-level courses w/ her since she used to teach 300-level courses. and i really hate taking notes down w/ listening to what she says. u can never catch up what she talks about since u'r already busy copying notes!Lots of notes,too lil time to copy

She is alright, but the course itself is horrible!  Too much writing, and she has high expectations...recalling what she said..."never expect an A from me, 66 is the average, and a paper that deserves an A is a paper that I'd say I WISH I HAD WRITTEN IT!" so, never expect anything high from her!
awful lectures.
B-O-R-I-N-G, maybe teaching some philosophy would be good, her lectures put me to sleep.
I find the lectures pretty useless. She is not very good at focusing on the assigned readings for the week. I leave the lecture hall more confused than when I went in.

lectures are so useless, im lucky i have a good TA, and its true that she goes on and on about assignments for way to long when it is not needed, and yes it is true that she seems nice, but she does not get deep into the topics we are studying in philosophy
definitely lots of discussions in lectures.
Awesome class, awesome prof. Engaging, professional, and interactive with the class. Knowledge and Reality is the class I look forward to the most.

she teaches philosophy as if it's history or literature review, without being philosophical about the topics at all.  you'll hear about the 'great men' without learning why they were great.  avoid introductory classes with this old-fashioned thinker.

Had her in my first semester two years ago...interesting lectures, has a sense of humor, papers and tests were fair with regards to difficulty...she even let me play a Prince CD at the start of class one day and she played R.E.M. a few times...cool
Excellent, inspirational prof.  Very clear and interesting.
nice and easy prof, make sure u take her if she teaches phil 100
Nice teacher, always accessible for help.  Hard paper topics but easy finals tho
Kind, funny, approachable
Great!
Nice prof.
borrrrringg! she was very monotone and i could not pay attention to her at all! and the material was really abstract and weird.. didnt like it at all
She knows her stuff.  She has high standards, which is refreshing at SFU.

one of the worst profs i have ever had! she rambles on and on during lectures and she doesnt seem to relate much of it to the notes. learned more off the slides then i did in class.. avoid if possible.

omg, this prof is so boring. I'm pretty sure she's a nice person but still her lectures are so pointless. she repeats for like half an hour. And her TAs are kinda bad too. They're not helpful at all. I think i failed this course. I'm gonna retake with another teacher -_-

Learned more about Philosophy listening to podcasts on the internet during lecture. Entire course is just memorizing a bunch of philosopher's theories.There's better profs and courses to take if you just need the credits.
No Comments
Very nice prof, easy course and easy exams
non-stop erm...ah..erm..ah...erm....erm makes the class super boring. exams are not tough.  use her notes.
heck; no idea what she's talkin' about... Philosophy drives me crazy.
Tests are pretty easy.  She gives you the exam essay questions in advance.  She takes the time to answer people's questions in class so that is good.

I love philosophy, but this course has totally turned me off to it. Her lectures are dull, boring, and dry. Nothing really makes you think. Tests are pretty straight forward. But i learn absolutely nothing from taking this course. Waste of time and money!
Super boring lecture, notes are good, but leave too much unanswer questions. Midterms and final are not tough, just need to read all the notes and that's it

Easy tests. If you don't read, you can easily study by reading notes from sparknotes.com and you can do well enough. Notes are long and have many questions. The answers are provided in lecture. So you have to listen in lecture even though it's boring!

This course is difficult.But she helps me make sense of it. Don't blame her as a boring professor. This is Phil, how fun can it be? She has the excellent teaching skill and lots of experience. Thank you , Lisa!

Fairly easy exams, more or less tells you what is going to be one it.  However, you may feel the need to gouge your eyes out with spoons after sitting in her lecture.  Public speaking classes should be required for profs to take before lecturing.

Beware...this class is pretty boring. Dont bother buying books, everything you need to know is on the overheads. Oh and make sure you turn off your cell phone-Shapiro cant stand it when they go off in her class.
Her exams are really easy.  Even for a person like me who have no logic whatsoever, I get a pretty good mark.
what was she talking about? she totally tuned me off philosophy and we were always behind in the reading becasue she can't explain things clearly.
Arrogant mannerisms and an apparent lack of interest in teach. Tough but fair grading.
No Comments
nice prof.. clear lecture...exams are fair...study hard and you will get a good mark
No Comments
tells u whats exactly on the exam, no trick questions, pretty easy

voice is EXTREMELY annoying! w/ her nasal  right?  every 5 min, my mind is ready to explode! lectures are kinda hard to follow. Seems like she's talking about a whole bunch of useless stuff, but you never know if she actually has a point or not. BAD
she's not that bad, just talks a bit too fast. Coz what she says are more useful than her notes.
she is bad bad bad bad bad bad....dunno understand at all..she sucks at teaching..
she is redundant redundant, has atrocious grammar, and runs lecture like grade 2
Her voice is like pavement being scratched with a metal rake

Ian is a really goof professor, his slides are easy and well explained. His lecture do not get us bored and are really easy to understand. Midterms and finals are easy. He helps a lot if any student have some concerns or questions regarding the Course material.
Great Teacher, makes topic interesting to students. Fun Lectures. However Ian could give out more Practice paper and Notes before Exams and quizzes.

Lyle is great, knowledgeable and responsible! His lecture is very inspiring and interesting! I'm not a Philosophy student, but after taking this class, I am very interested in Philosophy, if he has other philosophy courses in SFU, I definitely will take it again!

Good for an intro course; gives a basic method for analyzing contemporary philosophy articles. For students to succeed on exams, reading the articles thoroughly and taking adequate notes is essential. Written assignments require a bit more ingenuity on the students part. Lyle helps out a fair bit on this front by giving feedback where applicable.
HER SLIDES ARE AWFUL!!!!!!!!! I studied by myself the whole course. Terrible professor. Avoid her if you can!!!
BEST OF THE BEST! if one is serious to follow up her lecture that it. you have what u want. I would definitely take another class with her.

I enjoyed this class. The ideas were relevant and interesting.  She would go over the readings in class and help make them understandable, which was extremely helpful and why I suggest you attend lecture.  Memorization isn't useful most of the time, you need to understand the material
I am not sure why her rating is high, but she was beyond horrible.
The worst professor I have ever had. I have never ever seen any rude, mean teacher like this
Stay away from this class. The tests are impossible, avg was in the 50's. I am a good student and barely walked away with a c-. Def a gpa killer.

Her notes did nothing to clarify the very labyrinthine textbook she had chosen for us. She even apologized for the choice just before handing out our course evaluation sheets. The tutorials had little to no overlap with the lectures, and the final essay in this 100-LEVEL CLASS consisted of finding a contradiction in a Harvard graduate's thesis.

Took the course in Fall '08. Lecture notes are clear and easy to read, but they're available online, so don't bother going to class. She just reads her notes anyways. I only went to about 4/5 lectures the whole sem. Assignments require some thought and work, but plenty of time to complete paper. Her final was impossibly easy, mostly knowledge q's.

Marking scheme seems to be difficult and seems completely dependent on the TA. Lectures & tutorials didn't complement each other. Lectures are extremely boring; she basically just reads the notes. She spends way too much time on concepts that are almost entirely irrelevant from the core course material. Not recommended.

Overall, this course is quite boring. TA has greater power over marking than prof. If you meet wrong guy, you may fail in this course. When you write a paper, bodies should lead conclusion and be relevant.

the class material is quiet interesting and the books are not so hard if you are really interested in philosophy. however, the lect is very boring and the tutorial is really unconnected. Not a gpa booster, definitely!this course is hard, Not recommended!

Excessive workload considering it's a 100 level class. Tutorials and Lectures felt like two different classes, didn't connect well together at all in regards to assignments. Nice person, but speaks much too quietly and slowly resulting in boring lectures. One book was hardly even used. Not recommended.

Uh so she made us get two textbooks, and one was NEVER used. Anyways, she's really boring and talks too quietly, so nobody can really hear her. I don't know, but my TA marks really hard, the average for my tutorial is fail. I have no idea whether it is the prof that asks for too much or what. Seriously, just avoid the trouble!

Lectures are boring, and assignments are HARD. You need to understand the material completely, and not go off topic. She posts all the notes online, and since she reads off notes, lectures aren't mandatory. Your TA is what determines your understanding. Overall, average teacher.

I hated this class more than I could possibly describe. The textbook was ridiculous and much too difficult, the lectures did NOT help, and the tutorials focused on only the easier topics. The assignments were unreasonably difficult for a 100-level class. The subject matter was pretentious and trivial.

kinda annoyed how she told the class it wasn't curved AFTER the drop date... boring lectures, painful marks, brainwashing book that didn't make sense without lecture notes.  Not bad prof... but not recommended
BORING!!! TAs are just as bad.

im a business student, so i took philosophy to avoid any of the lower division english classes. and honestly, i regret it so so sooooo much. her lectures are okay, but she gives A LOT of assignments.. and her TAs are  HARD too...

Bases most of the assignments on the lectures so it's really useful to attend lecture and not really necessary to read the text (Thinking it through). The book used was really interesting (Stumbling on Happiness). She's a good prof, pretty organized, and the powerpoints are online after the lectures.
meh
Would not recommend her at all. Gives way too many assignments, lectures are boring and useless, and refuses to answer any emails (makes us go to office hours instead).
Very scattered but I love her Aridale science stories.
One of my favorite profs. She was very approachable and made the subject matter interesting for the students. Enjoyable lecturer- recommended, especially for non-Philosophy majors.
One of the best professors I have ever had.  Clear, relevant and passionate about phil.
No Comments
amazing lecturer but talks too fast
decent... easy course, he was clear and organized when lecturing..

Overall, great prof. He's really passionate about the subject and explains it pretty well. Only drawback is he talks too fast sometimes. Papers are very fair & rather short. Create good notes for the final as it is open book, and you should be good to go!
An inspired teacher.
An easy course. He hates cheating so all the exams are open-book. Just have good notes and you'll do great on exams. Finals are all MC!

Hahn is great.  Funny!  If you are willing to think, you'll love it.  If you just want to sleep, stay home!  Lets you use notes and books for tests to avoid cheating.  Still, you better study.  Uses many examples to help with data.
extraordinary sense of humou. Loves Descartes. alks sometimes unclear, fully devoted to the subject, but yeah, kind of fast. Sarcastic one.
he just reads you the text in note form from an overhead. rushed through most of the material after spending way too much time on descartes...
No Comments
easy marker but talks too fast during lectures
Talking is too fast for student to follow
Course is BORING but prof is alright.. IF phil isnt your thing, dont take it!!
Great Prof!
Makes things SO clear, and is funny too
Jim was a great prof. Super entertaining and explained things well. Lectures weren't mandatory but pretty helpful. Interesting content.

Great lecturer. Provides good notes and is clear. The class is hard, but its philosophy so it's supposed to be. Be careful on the tests, they are very tricky. An in depth understanding is needed, really more than you can study for.

You can tell he is really passionate about his teachings, and tries to make it as interesting as possible. His notes were clear, but exams were based mostly on material from the readings. Attend tutorials, they helped me most! Exams were fair as long as you READ!

You can tell he is very passionate about his teachings, and tries to make it as interesting as possible. His notes were clear, but the exams were mostly based on the materials from readings, which were often long and boring. Attend tutorials, they were the most useful for me! Exams were fair.

Clear and interesting lectures. However, he is completely anal in his style and he gives exams that he expects the average to be 40%! Feels like he wants you to fail. Hate the prof because of his actions, not his lectures though. Stay away from him.

I fell asleep in all my other classes but not in his - that's how captivating his teaching style is. However, things will sometimes make no sense but that's how it's supposed to be cause this class makes you think. His answers to questions can sometimes be ambiguous and the purpose is, again, to make you think on your own!
One of the Best prof I had ! his lecture is so organize and clear. if you are interested in philosophy you MUST take him as a prof !

Had him for Phil XX1 and 100W. He's a great prof, knows what he is doing. I attended all of the classes because he clarifies the reading and gives extra information. The midterm for 100W requires you to do the readings (big surprise) and to understand the material. Overall, take classes with him if you are here to learn.

I thought his exams were alright. you need to read every assigned readings. his final exam does not have more questions based on the post-quiz materials. he's very good at teaching but phil100 is a boring course...oh and his grading is weird...
I had him for Phi 100, he is an amazing prof, the class is very interesting. However, it's a HARD course ! exams is sooo hard!. but overall I learned lots of interesting stuff

lol horban is actually a really nice prof and his lecture r interesting, but this course is really hard and the material is pretty useless. oh and do the assign reading its important! good prof, bad course~!

Very clear lectures and notes. (The notes are not in "essay format"; they are in complete sentences. It's not as if he throws an essay onto the overhead and lectures off of that.) Essays can be a bit tough, but exams are easy if you think a bit and do the readings.

He is very well prepared for class. Very thorough and clear. And clearly a good instructor. However, his exams are extremely hard. I've barely passed the first 57%, and for finals I've gotten around 70% even after extensive studying. However, essays are farely easily marked depending on your T.A. Which boosted my marks. I got a B- for the course.
Very clear, and the examples that he gives in class really helps.  His tests are confusing in the sense that you can never know how well you did until he hands it back.

This prof likes his own voice wayyy too much.  He's very full of himself, his lectures are boring, and he is paranoid about plagarism so much he makes you use turnitin.com with HARSH penalties if you only hand in the hard copy of your paper and send the digital copy in late.  Misses the point of the class.  Much better PHIL profs out there.

This prof is a very good and clear lecturer. He really makes it easy to understand the topic. His midterm was fairly challenging, but fair (he is scaling it). The final was disappontingly easy, though. Essay assignments were all right.

Fail and scale! A mandatory class to satisfy writing requirements and immediately depress the frosh. The prof is clear in lecs, and the exams are easy... to fail miserably! Makes ppl wonder if they learned a lot or if they are blockheads. This course is really interesting but the exams have ruined it all. The TA was the best though.

Lectures are boring, notes are somewhat in the middle, but the quizzes, *sigh*, they're just useless, I must say.  Exams are supposed to help a student find out whether they understand the material or not.  Horban's quizzes are there to discourage your mark.  In fact, the class average was a fail...This is why I'm gonna take xx1 with another prof..
His exams suck. 'nuff said

I am a 3rd year student taking this class and in all honesty, i do not understand how a person in their right mind will ever take another Phil class after being taught by Prof. Horban. True, his lectures are clear and the material is very interesting. But those exams?!?!?! They test absolutely nothing! Very discouraging, And somewhat disappointing.

I've taken philosophy before, and it was such an interesting topic, that i felt like taking it again. He makes the topic too boring, philosophy can be a lot of fun, instead its just a very boring class now. No discussion,and his notes are all done in paragraphs..so hard to study off! He needs to talk to the class more rather than talk in class

I've taken 2 classes with this guy and he is an awesome lecturer. You can tell he is really interested in what he's teaching. Midterms are tricky but hey, it's philosophy. Overall, if you studied, you should be fine. The curve is a standard curve so only blame yourself for a bad mark.
he reminds me of the architect in the matrix
Not too bad.  Kinda funny........U noticed that he usually puts his pinky finger near his mouth when lecturing?  I found that to be hilarious
Was totally excited about philosoph, brought it to a teachable level Great Prof!
don't even think about copying all of his lecture notes
best prof I have ever had
His tests are hard...but he's good at lecturing

She was extremely unapproachable, and her lectures were difficult to follow. She records all lectures and posts the slides online, which was helpful for the papers. Overall, I would not recommend this course to anyone since most people in my tutorials also found the material really hard to understand.

Although the TA and him help you out with your two papers and give fair grades, the final exam was very difficult and imo not a fair exam. Even though the exam was open book and we can consult any sources, it's still a very hard exam and honestly I didn't feel prepared for at all even though I did not miss a single lecture nor tutorial.

It was an interesting class, I'm not really good at writing, but you get to submit a draft for the papers, and the TA's give feedback, so you can improve. The final was open book and the notes were really helpful. An easy class

I really enjoyed Martin's lectures, and his slides helped summarize them when reviewing content. For papers you hand in a draft and are given feedback (for completion marks) before then handing in a final draft, which was really helpful! Final exam was open book and online, it was difficult but ended up being curved.

Mumbles a bit during lecture so it is often difficult to hear the material he is presenting. Just read the slides, required readings and attend tutorial and this course should be fairly easy. This course consisted of: two papers and a final exam that is open book

Worst prof I've had in a while. I can't follow him in class so I gotta teach myself. Doesn't put any effort into teaching, but that's just my opinion. He is so jumpy when he explains stuff in class. SRSLY there is no way to know what he's saying. He starts at one topic and then jumps to another. Don't take classes with him if you value your sanity.
An awesome prof, definitely makes the class worthwhile !

i am not native english speaker.my first time  of phil100 was D. then i retake. this time is Jill. i deep read all materials,  collorate with TAs who mark the papers. then i got A-. if u start to like the subject, u will get good mark. dont rely on course notes,but on readings, they r hard to understand but they give u high grades

philosophy, you either get it or u don't.Its diff for every person. The content that is studied and discussed just plays with your mind. It starts out easy but it just gets worse and worse. and the book doesnt help at all. jill is alright a lil weird but i guess shes okay at teaching the course. the course itself is crazy more than she is lol.
As long as you pay attention in class, you'll be fine. Midterm isn't too hard, and tutorials are very helpful. Show up to office hours, you'll get all the help you need.

took both phil 100 and xx1-was not a good prof. makes sarcastic jokes when you dont know the answer. she emails fill in the blank notes which are good but then they make you want to skip class. notes are often vague. essays are hard. if it was for bell curve, everyone would fail

She knows her stuff and teaches well. Her notes are clear. The essay assignments are definitely tough but if you put the effort in you can do OK. The final exam was very hard but most probably she scaled it.

"Dr. Mac" supplies fill-in-the-blank style notes, which are pretty handy. She's good for a chat in her office. If you struggle with the basic concepts of Phil., you'll find her class challenging, but hopefully rewarding (you should be able to understand this material if you're in University!!!). Main con: sometimes lame humor, can be annoying.
This course is HARD! Well, if you take it with MacIntosh...you will need to write 2 papers which worth a lot, no midterm though, but I have no idea what she is talking about.
